title: Meghan Markle suffers awkward moment when hug goes very wrong at fancy event
text:

Meghan Markle looked happy and glamorous as she made her first public appearance since her revealing behind-the-scenes documentary, in which she spoke honestly about her struggle with the royal spotlight .

Wearing a recycled Aritzia purple dress she debuted during her pregnancy with Archie, Meghan beamed as she arrived at the Royal Albert Hall for the One Young World Summit opening ceremony.

She looked happy and relaxed as she met people from the organisation, but did suffer a rather embarrassing encounter as she walked on the stage to a huge round of applause.

She was greeted by Kate Robertson, one of the two founders, and went in for a friendly hug.

(Image: PA)

However Kate misjudged the situation and went to curtsy to Meghan and shake her hand, as is the correct protocol for members of the Royal Family,

The Duchess can be seen shaking her head and Kate realises what's happening a little too late, and starts the hug while still at the lower curtsy level.

(Image: PA)

Thankfully both women saw the fully side of the situation and laugh before enjoying a cute hug.

Meghan was the guest of honour at the opening ceremony which begins a four-day event, described as a "global forum for young leaders", brings together 2,000 young people from more than 190 countries.

She was sat next to Nobel Peace Prize recipient Professor Muhammad Yunus for the event.

(Image: PA)

(Image: David Fisher/REX)

London mayor Sadiq Khan , actor Warwick Davies and One Young World co-founders Kate Robertson and Dave Jones were among the speakers during the summit opening.

Mr Khan said: "When it comes to tackling the defining challenges of our time, we achieve more together than we do alone.

"This is the main message I want to send to you this evening. Shamefully there are some politicians who wish to absolve themselves from their positions of responsibility."

(Image: One World Summit)

According to the One Young World website, Meghan is a "long-standing supporter" of the organisation, having joined as a counsellor at the 2014 summit in Dublin.

Her appearance at the summit comes after a source close to the couple told CNN the reaction to Prince Harry's comments on the ITV documentary about being on a "different path" to his brother had been "hysterical".

The source said Harry and Meghan had "single-handedly modernised the monarchy" and added the couple were surrounded by people "afraid of and inexperienced" at how best to "deploy their value".
description: Meghan Markle was full of smiles as she arrived at the One Young World Summit opening ceremony in a Aritzia purple dress, but one key moment didn't exactly go to plan...
